ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Significantly improved my German skills - particularly listening and speaking. Also learned a lot about aspects of German and Austrian culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths- Prof Schenker is incredible, interesting course, Mindtap (the digital homework format) is great except when it's a bit faulty, and I loved the Napola movie!!
Weaknesses- Slightly too many presentations. I understand that speaking is important but it felt like I was spending a bit too much on building slideshows. The only other weakness is the asynchronous day. I really hated those because I felt like I was spending more time than I would be in class and learning less.
Very well-organized in terms of teaching a language. Workload felt a little high sometimes, but definitely felt prepared to use German in most settings after it

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely! Without a doubt, if you want to continue with German, take this class! It is so fun and you feel like you are both learning more about German culture and language together!
Definitely - it is very well-taught, and if you're interested in advancing your German, I would definitely recommend the summer course. It's definitely intensive, but

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will use all that I have learned to further my learning of German! I hope to improve and one day become fluent. When I do, I will never forget all that I have learned in this course.
In combination with the 140 course, I've become reasonably fluent in German. I'll definitely use it the next time I'm in a German speaking country, but also to consume German media and literature.
